stocks.name: TELUS Corporation
stocks.thesis: 5G capex tapering is driving a FCF surge — record $2.2B FCF in 2025, up 11% YoY with 10%+ CAGR guided through 2028. Dividend is frozen (not cut) at a 9.2% yield while you wait for the balance sheet to deleverage to 3.3x and the stock re-rates.
stocks.risks: High debt load and dividend growth paused; TELUS International drag and CRTC regulatory risk remain.

stocks.name: Cogeco Communications
stocks.thesis: Deeply mispriced cable/internet operator trading at 9.4x P/E vs sector average of 15x, with P/B below 1.0 and Alpha Spread intrinsic value of $122.93 — implying 44% undervaluation. S&P and Moody's improved credit outlooks Jan 2026; Morningstar 5-star rated.
stocks.risks: Cord-cutting structural headwind with revenue declining ~4% YoY, and $4.64B debt at 3.24x EBITDA.

stocks.name: ARC Resources
stocks.thesis: Premier Montney natural gas producer with exceptional dividend growth — 10x since 2020 including a +10.5% raise in January 2026. LNG Canada export tailwind coming online provides a multi-year earnings catalyst with a low payout ratio leaving room for further increases.
stocks.risks: Nat gas commodity price exposure and tariff/trade war impacts; Feb 6 drop of -10% needs recovery confirmation.

stocks.name: Alaris Equity Partners
stocks.thesis: Royalty income trust generating stable cash flows from private mid-market businesses, with an 8.82% dividend raise in January 2026. Crossed the 200-day moving average signalling improving momentum.
stocks.risks: Currently trading ABOVE all historical averages — not a screaming value; better entry would be around $20.

stocks.name: RioCan REIT
stocks.thesis: Grocery-anchored retail REIT trading at 12x forward FFO vs 15x long-term historical average — a 20% valuation discount implying ~$24.40 fair value (25% upside). Three analyst target upgrades in four days from National Bank, CIBC, and BMO; 19M unit buyback underway.
stocks.risks: Rate-sensitive retail REIT; Canadian consumer spending slowdown and historical dividend cut in COVID create psychological overhang.

stocks.name: BCE Inc.
stocks.thesis: Trading near 15-year lows with a 5% yield as the market prices in peak pessimism on fibre spending and competition. Debt deleveraging re-rating play if management executes on cost cuts and free cash flow improvement.
stocks.risks: CRTC regulatory uncertainty and Q1 2026 earnings could disappoint; dividend sustainability concerns if FCF doesn't recover.
